Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: İslam, İslâm, islam, islám, and íslam

English

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Islaam, Islām, Eslam (all very rare)

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed around 1610 from Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām, “submission, surrender”), verbal noun of أَسْلَمَ (ʔaslama), from the root س ل م (s l m).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈɪs.lɑːm/, /ˈɪz.lɑːm/, /ɪsˈlɑːm/, /ɪzˈlɑːm/, or with /-læm/
    • Audio (Southern England):(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɑːm, -æm

Proper noun

[edit]

Islam (usually uncountable, plural Islams)

  2. A monotheistic Abrahamic religion followed by Muslims that is based on the teachings of Muhammad and the Qur'an.
    • For quotations using this term, see Citations:Islam.
    1. Muslimdom (the sphere of influence of the religion).
      • 2003, Jacques Verger, edited by Hilde de Ridder-Symoens, A History of the University in Europe. Vol. I: Universities in the Middle Ages, Cambridge University Press, →ISBN, Patterns, pages 35–76:
        It is no doubt true that other civilizations, prior to, or wholly alien to, the medieval West, such as the Roman Empire, Byzantium, Islam, or China, were familiar with forms of higher education which a number of historians, for the sake of convenience, have sometimes described as universities.
  3. A male given name.
  4. A surname.

Synonyms

[edit]
  • Mohammedanism (dated, now often considered offensive)
  • Moslemism, Muslimism
  • Islamism

Hypernyms

[edit]
  • religion, monotheism, Abrahamism

[edit]

  • Nation of Islam

  • Prislam
  • Siqatul Islam

[edit]

  • Islamic calendar
  • Islamise, Islamize
  • Islamism
  • Islamist
  • Islamness
  • Islamologist
  • Islamology
  • Islamophobia

Albanian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām).

Proper noun

[edit]

Islam m

  1. a male given name, Islam, from Arabic

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Islam
singular
indefinite definite
nominative Islam Islami
accusative Islamin
dative/ablative Islami Islamit

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Islaam

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ɪsˈlaːm/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Proper noun

[edit]

Islam m (proper noun, strong, genitive Islams or Islam)

  1. Islam
    Synonym: (dated) Mohammedanismus

See also

[edit]
  • Muslim
    • Muslimin, Muslima

Indonesian

[edit]
Indonesian Wikipedia has an article on:
Islam
Wikipedia id

Etymology

[edit]

From Malay Islam, from Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām).[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ˈɪslam]
  • Rhymes: -lam, -am, -m
  • Hyphenation: Is‧lam

Proper noun

[edit]

Islam

  1. (religion, Islam) Islam

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Selam (colloquial)

Derived terms

[edit]
  • berislam
  • diislamkan
  • keberislaman
  • keislaman
  • mengislamkan
  • pengislaman

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Erwina Burhanuddin; Abdul Gaffar Ruskhan; R.B. Chrismanto (1993), Penelitian kosakata bahasa Arab dalam bahasa Indonesia [Research on Arabic vocabulary in Indonesian]‎[1], Jakarta: Pusat Pembinaan dan Pengembangan Bahasa, Departemen Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan, →ISBN, →OCLC

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Islam”, in Kamus Besar Bahasa Indonesia [Great Dictionary of the Indonesian Language] (in Indonesian), Jakarta: Agency for Language Development and Cultivation – Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia, 2016

Malay

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [is.lam]
    • Audio (Malaysia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -lam, -am
  • Hyphenation: Is‧lam

Proper noun

[edit]

Islam (Jawi spelling إسلام)

  1. (religion) Islam

Affixations

[edit]
  • islamkan
  • keislaman
  • pengislaman

Compounds

[edit]
  • Islam baka
  • masuk Islam
  • orang Islam, umat Islam
  • rukun Islam

Descendants

[edit]
  • Indonesian: Islam

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Islam”, in Pusat Rujukan Persuratan Melayu [Malay Literary Reference Centre] (in Malay), Kuala Lumpur: Dewan Bahasa dan Pustaka, 2017

Tagalog

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām, “submission”), possibly through Spanish, English, or Philippine languages spoken mostly by Muslims.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (Standard Tagalog) IPA(key): /ʔisˈlam/ [ʔɪsˈlam]
  • Rhymes: -am
  • Syllabification: Is‧lam

Proper noun

[edit]

Islám (Baybayin spelling ᜁᜐ᜔ᜎᜋ᜔)

  1. Islam
    Synonyms: Islamismo, Mahometismo

Related terms

[edit]
  • Islamista
  • Muslim

See also

[edit]
  • isnan

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Islam”, in Pambansang Diksiyonaryo | Diksiyonaryo.ph, Manila, 2018.
  • The template Template:R:Vocabulario de la lengua tagala 1860 does not use the parameter(s): 
    page=159
    Please see Module:checkparams for help with this warning.    Noceda, Fr. Juan José de; Sanlucar, Fr. Pedro de (1860), Vocabulario de la lengua tagala, compuesto por varios religiosos doctos y graves, y coordinado por…, ultimamente aumentado y corregido por varios religiosos de la Orden de Agustinos calzados.‎[2] (overall work in Spanish and Classical Tagalog), Manila: Ramírez y Giraudier.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • misal, limas, silam, malis, samil

Welsh

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Islâm (GPC spelling)

Etymology

[edit]

From Arabic إِسْلَام (ʔislām, “submission, surrender”), verbal noun of أَسْلَمَ (ʔaslama), from the root س ل م (s l m).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈɪslam/

Proper noun

[edit]

Islam m or f

  1. Islam

Related terms

[edit]
  • Islamaidd (“Islamic”)
  • Mwslim (“muslim”)

References

[edit]
